articles.author: John Irish, Elizabeth Pineau
articles.description: The acceleration in Ukraine diplomacy means Europe needs to do more and in a better way, a French presidency official said ahead of informal talks later on Monday among several key European leaders in Paris.
articles.title: Fast-moving Ukraine diplomacy means Europeans must do more, official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Spanish Foreign Minister Jose Manuel Albares said European leaders will discuss in Paris on Monday how to prevent a peace negotiation on Ukraine ending up rewarding Russian aggression.
articles.title: European leaders seek to prevent rewarding Russian aggression, Spain says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Taiwan Strait is absolutely "not within the scope of China's sovereignty", and any deliberate Chinese attempts to create tension will pose a real threat to global security, the island's defence ministry said on Monday.
articles.title: Taiwan Strait does not belong to China, Taiwan defence ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Russian court has fined Alphabet's Google 3.8 million roubles ($41,530) for hosting content on YouTube that included videos instructing Russian soldiers how to surrender, Russia's TASS news agency reported on Monday.
articles.title: Russia fines Google for YouTube clip telling Russian troops how to surrender, TASS says

articles.author: Juliette Jabkhiro
articles.description: When police in western France searched surgeon Joel Le Scouarnec's home after he raped his 6-year-old neighbour in 2017, they found a cache of sex dolls, wigs and child pornography.
articles.title: After shocking Pelicot crimes, French surgeon to face trial in child sex abuse case

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Singapore on Monday found opposition Workers' Party leader Pritam Singh guilty of two counts of lying to parliament, a verdict that could see him barred from contesting a general election this year.
articles.title: Singapore opposition party leader Pritam Singh found guilty of lying to parliament

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A court in Mauritius has released former Prime Minister Pravind Jugnauth on bail following his arrest on charges of money laundering, a magistrate at the court said.
articles.title: Mauritius' former prime minister gets bail on money laundering charges

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran has defended its nuclear programme and will not allow any weakness in this regard, Iran's Foreign Ministry Spokesperson Esmaeil Baghaei said on Monday, a day after Israel and the US vowed to counter Iran's nuclear ambitions.
articles.title: Iran will not allow any weakness in regards to its nuclear programme, Foreign Ministry says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin has sent his foreign minister and a senior Kremlin adviser to meet U.S. officials in Saudi Arabia on Tuesday to discuss restoring relations and possible talks to end the war in Ukraine, the Kremlin said on Monday.
articles.title: Putin sends Russia's top diplomat and Kremlin adviser to meet Trump officials in Saudi Arabia

articles.author: Tanvi Mehta
articles.description: An Indian court jailed a 31-year-old man for life on Monday following the rape and murder of a young Irish woman in the tourist resort state of Goa, nearly eight years after the crime.
articles.title: Indian court jails man for life in rape, killing of Irish woman
